main event: On February 5, 1958, a bright light was observed approaching from the west, passing east at a fast rate of speed, without any sound, and disappeared after 10-15 seconds in W of Winslow, N of Winslow, and E of Flagstaff, Arizona. An additional sighting on February 6 involved visual observation of a UFO for about 110 seconds, with a description of a D-2 type object by personnel of the 33rd Bombardment Wing.
interesting points: The bright light observed was larger than a bright star and made no sound as it passed by at a fast rate of speed.
A UFO was visually observed for about 110 seconds by military personnel of the 33rd Bombardment Wing at an altitude of 29,000 feet in Arizona on February 6.
Descriptions of the observed object varied, with some reporting it as round or cigar-shaped, metallic or light in color, and appearing to tumble or turn over in flight.
One observer reported that the object appeared to be broken into four parts, resembling a 'cracked mirror'.
Despite varied descriptions of the object, the available information seemed to indicate that it might have been some form of conventional aircraft or a type of light balloon.
sighted object: bright light and D-2 type object
location: W of Winslow, N of Winslow, and E of Flagstaff, Arizona
